ECU Events

ECU Events contains any ECU event components in the referenced FPGA. ECU Events measure the signals provided by the ECU and provide time related and/or angle related information synchronized to the Engine Simulation.

What do you want to do?

Add ECU event(s)

To add ECU event(s), click the Add ECU Event(s) button. You also can right-click ECU Events in the configuration tree and select Add ECU Event(s) from the shortcut menu.

Remove ECU event(s)

To remove a single ECU event, select the ECU event in the configuration tree and click the red X button.

To remove multiple ECU events, click the Remove ECU Event(s) button. You also can right-click ECU Events in the configuration tree and select Remove ECU Event(s) from the shortcut menu.

View or change an ECU event

To view or change an ECU event, select the ECU event item in the configuration tree. The ECU Event page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

For more information about adding and configuring custom devices, refer to the Configuring and Running a Project book of the NI VeriStand Help, available by selecting Help»Search the NI VeriStand Help.
